org.pikater.shared.util

Class IOUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pikater.shared.util.IOUtils

  • public class IOUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class handling some common tasks related to files and paths.
    Author:
    SkyCrawl

      • setAbsoluteBaseAppPath

        public static void setAbsoluteBaseAppPath(java.lang.String baseAbsAppPath)
        This method must be called prior to using any other path-related methods from this class.
        Parameters:
        baseAbsAppPath - absolute path to this application (the "src" folder's parent folder)

      • getAbsoluteBaseAppPath

        public static java.lang.String getAbsoluteBaseAppPath()
        Gets the path set with setAbsoluteBaseAppPath(String). If null, throws an exception.

      • joinPathComponents

        public static java.lang.String joinPathComponents(java.lang.String prefixPath,
                                  java.lang.String suffixPath)
        Abstract method to join string-defined paths. Automatically handles directory separation.
        Parameters:
        suffixPath - may denote a directory or file but must NOT be an absolute path

      • getRelativePath

        public static java.lang.String getRelativePath(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Gets an absolute path to the given class - consists of 2 parts:
        1. Absolute path to the application. See setAbsoluteBaseAppPath(String), which must be called prior to this method.
        2. Relative source path to the given class.

      • readTextFile

        public static java.lang.String readTextFile(java.lang.String filePath)
        Reads the content of the given file to a string.

        Writes the given content to the given using the given charset.

      • createTemporaryFile

        public static java.io.File createTemporaryFile(java.lang.String directory,
                               java.lang.String prefix,
                               java.lang.String extension)
        Creates a temporary file in the given directory, with given extension.
        Parameters:
        extension - must include a dot, e.g. ".jpg"
